Description.name: Headache
Description.info: Migraines and other types of headaches, such as tension headache and sinus headache, are painful. Migraine symptoms include a pounding headache, nausea, vomiting, and light sensitivity.
Description.cure: It is treated with antinausea drugs and abortive or preventive medications. Headache remedies include pain relievers.
Description.prec: Have more Water. Avoid Stress. Avoid Liquors.Dont look at bright lights/Sun

Description.name: Chicken Pox
Description.info: Chickenpox, also known as varicella, is a highly contagious disease caused by the initial infection with varicella zoster virus (VZV). The disease results in a characteristic skin rash that forms small, itchy blisters, which eventually scab over.
Description.cure: Actually there is no way to cure chicken pox, but there are few ways to get cured by itself by taking oatmeal baths,applying cool compresses and taking antihistamines
Description.prec: Take Antiviral medication once you feel some symptoms of chicken pox, one such drug is Aciclovir

Description.name: Jaundice
Description.info: Jaundice, also known as icterus, is a term used to describe a yellowish tinge to the skin and sclerae (the white part of the eye) that is caused by an excess of bilirubin in the blood (hyperbilirubinemia).Body fluids may also be yellow.
Description.cure: Liver biopsy may be required if it is post-hepatic jaundice
Description.prec: Avoid Liquor consumption,Maintain body wegight,Have more water,Proper exposure to sunlight

Description.name: Typhoid
Description.info: Typhoid is an infection caused by the bacteria Salmonella typhimurium. The bacterium lives in the intestines and bloodstream of humans. It is spread between individuals by direct contact with the feces of an infected person.No animals carry this disease, so transmission is always human to human.
Description.cure: Cold compresses, Increased fluid intakes, Homemade ORS, Apple cider vinegar
Description.prec: Drink boiled water, Avoid street foods, also avoid unhealthy Drinks

Description.name: Skin Rashes
Description.info: Eczema, or atopic dermatitis, is a rash that primarily occurs in people with asthma or allergies.The rash is often reddish and itchy with a scaly texture. Psoriasis is a common skin condition  that can cause a scaly, itchy, red rash to form along the scalp, elbows, and joints.
Description.cure: Use Olive oil, Oat meal, Aloe vera. Use gentle soaps, such as Basis, Cetaphil, Dove, or Oil of Olay, and use as little soap as possible.
Description.prec: Keep cool, and stay out of the sun. Keep the itchy area cool and moist. Avoid scratching if infected

Description.name: Back Pain
Description.info: pidural steroid injections are most commonly used in situations of radicular pain, which is a radiating pain that is transmitted away from the spine by an irritated spinal nerve. Irritation of a spinal nerve in the low back (lumbar radiculopathy) causes pain that goes down the leg.
Description.cure: Fix your posture, Go for healthy massage, Try Rubs and Ointments, Adjust How You Sleep.
Description.prec: Maintain a healthy weight, Keep your back muscles strong, Focus on good posture, Lift properly

Description.name: Flu
Description.info: The flu is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses that infect the nose, throat, and lungs. It can cause mild to severe illness, and at times can lead to death. The best way to prevent the flu is by getting a flu vaccine each year.
Description.cure: Antiviral medication. In 2009, the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) recommended that doctors should consider treating people in the at-risk groups mentioned above with the antiviral medications oseltamivir (Tamiflu) or zanamivir (Relenza) to reduce the risk of complications of flu.
Description.prec: Use face mask when you enter polluted area/drainage areas/Poultry farms/Cattle farms

Description.name: Conjunctivitis
Description.info: Red eyes with burning sensation that pains frequently and easily communicable disease
Description.cure: Cold compresses,Regularly wash your eyes with cold water, Avoid direct exposure to sunlight
Description.prec: Dont look at the eyes of infected person,Keep your eye clean, wash regularly with cold water

Description.name: Common Cold
Description.info: Common cold, also known simply as a cold, is a viral infectious disease of the upper respiratory tract that primarily affects the nose. The throat, sinuses, and voice box may also be affected. They include coughing,sore throat, runny nose, sneezing, headache, and fever.
Description.cure: Have cough syrup, avoid over dosages, Sleep well, Have a teaspoon of honey, breathe in steam
Description.prec: Avoid dirty air, drink boiled water, Use Hand Kerchief while you/others sneeze

Description.name: Sore Throat
Description.info: A sore throat is pain, scratchiness or irritation of the throat that often worsens when you swallow. The most common cause of a sore throat (pharyngitis) is a viral infection, such as a cold or the flu. A sore throat caused by a virus resolves on its own.
Description.cure: Gargle With Warm Salt Water. Mix up an ACV drink, Suck on Garlic, Drink Licorice Root Tea
Description.prec: Drink more water, avoid spicy foods

Description.name: Asthma
Description.info: Asthma is a chronic disease involving the airways in the lungs. This makes it difficult for air to move in and out of the lungs, causing symptoms such as coughing, wheezing, shortness of breath and/or chest tightness.
Description.cure: Have cough syrup, avoid over dosages, Sleep well, Have a teaspoon of honey, breathe in steam
Description.prec: Drink boiled water, Take care when you enter dustful region.

Description.name: Noro Virus
Description.info: Norovirus is a very contagious virus that can infect anyone. You can get it from an infected person, contaminated food or water, or by touching contaminated surfaces. The virus causes your stomach or  intestines or both to get inflamed. This leads you to have stomach pain, nausea, and diarrhea and to throw up.
Description.cure: There is no specific medicine to treat people with norovirus illness. Norovirus infection cannot be treated with antibiotics because it is a viral (not a bacterial) infection
Description.prec: Your hygienicity saves you from this virus, keep yourself clean and your surroundings clean.

Description.name: Painful Joints
Description.info: Joints form the connections between bones. They provide support and help you move. ... Many different conditions can lead to painful joints, including osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, bursitis, gout, strains, sprains, and other injuries. Joint pain is extremely common.
Description.cure: Apply Pain Balm, Pain killer to get rid of joint pains
Description.prec: Fix your posture , sit/stand with perfect posture, Avoid controlling urine for long time.

Description.name: Heart Attcks
Description.info: Heart attacks most often occur as a result of coronary heart disease (CHD), also called coronary artery disease. ... These arteries supply oxygen-rich blood to your heart. When plaque builds up in the arteries,the condition is called atherosclerosis.
Description.cure: Go to nearby medication centre and follow the prescriptions.
Description.prec: Avoid stress, Have sufficient quantity of water according to the age. Aged people may have less amount of water, to avoid strokes.

Description.name: Dry Skin
Description.info: Skin conditions and rashes. Many skin conditions itch, including eczema (dermatitis), psoriasis, scabies,lice, chickenpox and hives. The itching usually affects specific areas and is accompanied by other signs,such as red, irritated skin or bumps and blisters.
Description.cure: Use Skin moisturizer to get rid of dry skin problems
Description.prec: Have more water, apply moisturizer when you travel during hot sunny day

Description.name: Fever
Description.info: Increased body temperature, Soaked eyes,over Tiredness
Description.cure: An old folk remedy for treating a fever is to soak a sheet in cold water and wrap yourself in it. Today, doctors advise against lowering your body temperature too quickly, so if you try this remedy, use slightly cool, not cold, water. Cover the wet sheet with a large beach towel or blanket, then lie down for about 15 minutes. Unwrap yourself when the wet sheet starts to get warm
Description.prec: Have boiled water, avoid cold food items, maintain optimum body temperature.

Description.name: Sore Throat
Description.info: A sore throat is pain, scratchiness or irritation of the throat that often worsens when you swallow. The most common cause of a sore throat (pharyngitis) is a viral infection, such as a cold or the flu. A sore throat caused by a virus resolves on its own.
Description.cure: Gargle With Warm Salt Water. Mix up an ACV drink, Suck on Garlic, Drink Licorice Root Tea
Description.prec: Drink more water, avoid spicy foods

Description.name: Allergic Asthma
Description.info: Asthma is a chronic disease involving the airways in the lungs. This makes it difficult for air to move in and out of the lungs, causing symptoms such as coughing, wheezing, shortness of breath and/or chest tightness.
Description.cure: Have cough syrup, avoid over dosages, Sleep well, Have a teaspoon of honey, breathe in steam
Description.prec: Drink boiled water, Take care when you enter dustful region.

Description.name: Stomach ulcer
Description.info: The decrease in the stomach's mucus lining that leads to an ulcer is usually caused by one of the following: an infection with the bacterium Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) long-term use of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), such as aspirin and ibuprofen.
Description.cure: To treat an ulcer, eat at least three ripe bananas a day. If you do not like eating bananas, you can make banana milkshakes.
Description.prec: Avoid foods that irritate your stomach, Stop smoking, Practice moderation, Take nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDS including aspirin and ibuprofen) with food, as this may decrease your risk of irritating the lining of your stomach

Description.name: Heart Failure
Description.info: Heart failure is a condition in which the heart can't pump enough blood to meet the body's needs.In some cases, the heart can't fill with enough blood. In other cases, the heart can't pump blood to the rest of the body with enough force. Some people have both problems.
Description.cure: Go to nearby medication centre immediately
Description.prec: Reduce stress, avoid unhealthy oil foods, avoid street foods.

Description.name: Pink eye
Description.info: Pinkeye (also called conjunctivitis) is redness and swelling of the conjunctiva, the mucous membrane that lines the eyelid and eye surface. The lining of the eye is usually clear. ... Most cases of pinkeye are caused by: Infections caused by viruses or bacteria.
Description.cure: If the pinkeye is caused by an infection, then a warm, moist compress may soothe your eye and help reduce redness and swelling. Warm, moist compresses can spread infection from one eye to the other. Use a different compress for each eye, and use a clean compress for each application.
Description.prec: Don't touch your eyes with your hands.Change your pillowcases often.Throw away your eye cosmetics, such as mascara.

Description.name: Dark Circles Around Eyes
Description.info: Mild black shades around eyes that gives odd look.
Description.cure: Mix one teaspoon of tomato juice with one and a half teaspoon of lemon juice.Gently apply this mixture on your dark circles and allow it to sit for 10 minutes.Rinse it off well with cool water
Description.prec: Apply cold slices of cucumber to lighten dark circles.Get a good night's sleep to alleviate those shadows.Eat plenty of fruits, vegetables and foods rich in vitamins.

Description.name: Nasal Congestion
Description.info: Gives irritated feel while doing important chores.
Description.cure: Use a humidifier or vaporizer, Take long showers or breathe in steam from a pot of warm (but not too hot) water.
Description.prec: Get a flu shot yearly, Quit smoking, Eat a well-balanced diet and get regular exercise

Description.name: Clear Runny Nose
Description.info: Liquy mucus keeps on expelled by nose gives irritation and leads to head ache.
Description.cure: Antihistamines. If you're suffering from sniffling, sneezing, itchy, watery eyes, and/or a runny nose, a product with an antihistamine is your best bet
Description.prec: Maintain optimum body temperature. breathe in the pure air as much as possible.

Description.name: Flu
Description.info: The flu is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses that infect the nose, throat, and lungs. It can cause mild to severe illness, and at times can lead to death. The best way to prevent the flu is by getting a flu vaccine each year.
Description.cure: Antiviral medication. In 2009, the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) recommended that doctors should consider treating people in the at-risk groups mentioned above with the antiviral medications oseltamivir (Tamiflu) or zanamivir (Relenza) to reduce the risk of complications of flu.
Description.prec: Use face mask when you enter polluted area/drainage areas/Poultry farms/Cattle farms

Description.cure: An old folk remedy for treating a fever is to soak a sheet in cold water and wrap yourself in it. Today, doctors advise against lowering your body temperature too quickly, so if you try this remedy, use slightly cool, not cold, water. Cover the wet sheet with a large beach towel or blanket, then lie down for about 15 minutes. Unwrap yourself when the wet sheet starts to get warm
Description.prec: Have boiled water, avoid cold food items, maintain optimum body temperature.

Description.name: Sore Throat
Description.info: A sore throat is pain, scratchiness or irritation of the throat that often worsens when you swallow. The most common cause of a sore throat (pharyngitis) is a viral infection, such as a cold or the flu. A sore throat caused by a virus resolves on its own.
Description.cure: Gargle With Warm Salt Water. Mix up an ACV drink, Suck on Garlic, Drink Licorice Root Tea
Description.prec: Drink more water, avoid spicy foods

Description.name: Cholera
Description.info: Cholera is an infectious disease that causes severe watery diarrhea, which can lead to dehydration and even death if untreated. It is caused by eating food or drinking water contaminated with a bacterium called Vibrio cholerae
Description.cure: Cholera requires immediate treatment because the disease can cause death within hours. Rehydration. The goal is to replace lost fluids and electrolytes using a simple rehydration solution, oral rehydration salts (ORS). The ORS solution is available as a powder that can be reconstituted in boiled or bottled water
Description.prec: Drink and use safe water, Wash your hands often with soap and safe water

Description.name: Dengue
Description.info: Dengue fever is a mosquito-borne tropical disease caused by the dengue virus. Symptoms typically begin three to fourteen days after infection. This may include a high fever, headache, vomiting, muscle and joint pains, and a characteristic skin rash
Description.cure: Treatment for Dengue Fever. There is no specific medicine to treat dengue infection. If you think you may have dengue fever, you should use pain relievers with acetaminophen and avoid medicines with aspirin, which could worsen bleeding. You should also rest, drink plenty of fluids, and see your doctor.
Description.prec: Stay in air-conditioned or well-screened housing, Wear protective clothing, Use mosquito repellent

Description.name: Malaria
Description.info: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease affecting humans and other animals caused by parasitic protozoans (a group of single-celled microorganisms) belonging to the Plasmodium type. Malaria causes symptoms that typically include fever, feeling tired, vomiting, and headaches.
Description.cure: If the right drugs are used, people who have malaria can be cured and all the malaria parasites can be cleared from their body. However, the disease can continue if it is not treated or if it is treated with the wrong drug. Some drugs are not effective because the parasite is resistant to them
Description.prec: avoid mosquito bites by using insect repellent, covering your arms and legs, and using a mosquito net.

Description.name: Cold
Description.info: cold, is a viral infectious disease of the upper respiratory tract that primarily affects the nose. The throat, sinuses, and voice box may also be affected. They include coughing,sore throat, runny nose, sneezing, headache, and fever.
Description.cure: Have cough syrup, avoid over dosages, Sleep well, Have a teaspoon of honey, breathe in steam
Description.prec: Avoid dirty air, drink boiled water, Use Hand Kerchief while you/others sneeze
